title: Showers expected in certain parts after 1pm
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (13), the Department of Meteorology says.

title: Mexican mayoral candidate gunned down during live broadcast of campaign rally
byline: What began as a festive campaign march quickly turned into a scene of terror in the Mexican state of Veracruz on Sunday night when a mayoral candidate was gunned down alongside three other people.

title: Salt shortage in market; prices soar
byline: The Salt Producers’ Association has raised concerns over a shortage of salt in the local market, attributing the situation to a delay in the arrival of imported stocks.

title: 5-member committee appointed to probe Gerandi Ella bus accident
byline: A special investigative committee has been named to probe the tragic bus accident, which claimed the lives of 22 individuals in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda in the early hours of Sunday (11), Police said.

title: Cannes Film Festival bans nudity and ‘voluminous’ outfits on the red carpet
byline: Cannes is making it official: nudity and “excessively voluminous” clothing are not welcome on the red carpet of the Palais.

title: 19-year-old girl dies following house fire in Kottawa
byline: A teenager, who was alone in a house down Rukmalgama Temple road in Kottawa, has died under suspicious circumstances after her body caught fire, according to the Kottawa Police.

title: Massive crowds at Derana’s 24-hr ‘Vesak Dansala’
byline: Large crowds continue to converge to the Independence Square in Colombo where Sri Lanka’s largest 24-hour ‘Vesak Dansala’, organized by Derana Media Network is taking place.

title: Now every terrorist knows price of removing women’s ‘Sindoor’: PM Modi
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday praised Operation Sindoor, stating that it is not just a name but a reflection of the nation’s countless emotions.

title: Eight ‘Dansal’ suspended for failing to comply with safety procedures
byline: Steps have been taken to suspend eight ‘Dansal’ that failed to comply with proper health and safety procedures, the Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union said.

title: Australia’s Liberal Party names first female leader after historic election loss
byline: Australia’s Liberal Party has for the first time chosen a woman as its leader, with Sussan Ley to take over from Peter Dutton after he led the party to a bruising election loss.

title: Devinuwara school teacher arrested for allegedly sexually abusing student
byline: A school teacher in Devinuwara has been apprehended by the Matara Division of the Bureau for the Investigation of Abuse of Children and Women over allegations of sexual abuse.

title: Sri Lanka’s adventure tourism market projected to hit USD 2.1 billion by 2035: report
byline: The Sri Lanka hiking and trekking tourism market is poised for remarkable growth, with its market size estimated to reach USD 780 million by 2025 and projected to expand to a staggering USD 2.1 billion by 2035, according to industry forecasts.

title: Russia responsible for downing of MH17, UN body rules
byline: Russia was responsible for the downing of the Malaysia Airlines flight, MH17, over eastern Ukraine in July 2014, the United Nations aviation agency has ruled.

title: 16 motorcycles including 4 illegally assembled high-capacity bikes seized
byline: A total of 16 motorcycles, including four high-capacity bikes that were assembled by illegally importing spare parts, have been seized by the Bandaragama Police.

title: Pakistani actors removed from Hindi film posters amid rising India-Pakistan tensions
byline: Pakistani actors like Mahira Khan and Fawad Khan have seemingly vanished from the promotional posters of their Bollywood films Raees and Kapoor & Sons, respectively.

title: Samsung launches slimmest smartphone as races against rival Apple
byline: Samsung Electronics made public on Tuesday its slimmest flagship model to date, complete with enhanced artificial intelligence features, as it seeks to get ahead of rival Apple in the premium market.

title: Police team investigating Gerandi Ella bus accident visits crash site
byline: The special investigative committee appointed to probe the tragic bus accident, which claimed the lives of 22 individuals in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda on Sunday (11), has visited the crash site.

title: India considers counter duties on US products, notice to WTO shows
byline: India is looking at levying import duties on some products made in the United States to counter Washington’s tariffs on steel and aluminium products, a document submitted to the World Trade Organization shows.

title: Heat warning issued for several districts
byline: A warm weather advisory has been issued for residents of the Ampara, Batticaloa, Polonnaruwa and Monaragala districts.

title: Two persons arrested in connection with shooting incident in Mount Lavinia
byline: Two individuals have been arrested in connection with the murder of a person in a shooting incident that occurred at a junction adjacent to the Sylvester Road in Mount Lavinia earlier this month.

title: Two girls drown in Galgamuwa Palukadawala Lake
byline: Two girls, aged 12 and 17, have drowned while bathing in the Palukadawala Lake in Galgamuwa this afternoon (13), Police said.

title: Singapore sees rise in COVID-19 cases as authorities say ‘periodic’ waves are expected
byline: Singapore’s health authorities are monitoring a recent increase in COVID-19 cases, even as they expect periodic waves of infection throughout the year.

title: Pakistan PM declares success of operation against India
byline: Pakistan Prime Minister Muhammad Shehbaz Sharif said on Tuesday (May 13) that the country’s offensive against India was a “grand success”, declaring that the achievement be celebrated on May 10 every year.

title: 36 motorcyclists arrested for reckless riding during Vesak Day celebrations
byline: Thirty-six motorcyclists, who were riding recklessly while causing panic among the public on Vesak Poya Day, have been arrested by the Matara Police yesterday (12).

title: Passengers’ belongings in Gerandi Ella bus accident safely stored: Police
byline: The belongings of the passengers involved in the recent bus accident that occurred in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda—including travel bags, mobile phones, and other items—have been safely stored at the Kotmale Police Station, Police said.

title: Trump starts Gulf visit in Saudi Arabia, focus on mega economic deals
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump began a tour of wealthy Gulf states on Tuesday by visiting Saudi Arabia, with his focus on securing trillions of dollars in investments rather than security issues ranging from war in Gaza to Iran’s nuclear program.
